title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the paper under the title section.

extractions.description: The paper proposes a framework called Representational Ethical Model Calibration to ensure epistemic equity in healthcare models by evaluating model performance across diverse population representations. It demonstrates its use with a focus on glycaemic control prediction from UK Biobank data, utilizing representation learning to capture patient diversity and guide model remediation.

type.justification: The paper demonstrates the application of the proposed framework to large-scale multimodal data from UK Biobank, indicating that it includes empirical analysis and experimentation.
type.quote: We demonstrate the use of the framework on large-scale multimodal data from UK Biobank to derive diverse representations of the population, quantify model performance, and institute responsive remediation.

name.justification: The focus is on ensuring epistemic equity in healthcare models, particularly in guiding clinical care.
name.quote: Equity is widely held to be fundamental to the ethics of healthcare.

name.justification: The paper discusses evaluating model equity which is part of quantitative ethics, especially in healthcare settings.
name.quote: Our results are relevant to the domains of quantitative ethics, multidimensional fairness, and the regulation of mathematical models in healthcare.

name.justification: The paper utilizes machine learning techniques such as representation learning to evaluate and ensure model equity.
name.quote: We employ deep representation learning based on autoencoders owing to their architectural simplicity and expressivity, and established applications in healthcare.

name.justification: The paper mentions a feed-forward neural network model applied for the regression task of predicting glycaemic levels.
name.quote: A regression model based on a conventional fully-connected feed-forward net with three hidden layers.

is_contributed.justification: The use of feed-forward neural networks is common and not introduced as a novel contribution in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: A regression model based on a conventional fully-connected feed-forward net with three hidden layers.

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses details of evaluating this neural network model, implying execution.
is_executed.quote: A regression model... was evaluated across the population as a whole.

is_compared.justification: The model's performance is compared across different population subgroups to identify disparities.
is_compared.quote: Examination of performance independently stratified by sex, smoking, and deprivation revealed substantial disparities in model fidelity.

referenced_paper_title.value: Adam: A method for stochastic optimization
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references the Adam optimizer, commonly associated with the paper by Kingma and Ba.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The model was trained using gradient descent with a batch size of 10 and the Adam optimiser with a learning rate of 0.001, as has been shown to perform well in a variety of contexts.

name.justification: The paper utilizes an autoencoder for embedding participants into latent representational space.
name.quote: To permit the identification of underperformance localised to more complex subpopulations defined by the interactions of multiple factors, we used an autoencoder.

is_contributed.justification: Autoencoders are standard techniques in machine learning and not introduced as a new contribution by the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We employ deep representation learning based on autoencoders owing to their architectural simplicity and expressivity, and established applications in healthcare.

is_executed.justification: The autoencoder is trained to create a latent space representation of participants, indicating execution.
is_executed.quote: We used an autoencoder to embed participants in a two-dimensional latent representational space.

is_compared.justification: The autoencoder is used for representation learning rather than direct performance comparison.
is_compared.quote: To permit the identification of underperformance localised to more complex subpopulations defined by the interactions of multiple factors, we used an autoencoder to embed participants in a two-dimensional latent representational space.

referenced_paper_title.value: Representation learning: A review and new perspectives
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper cites Bengio et al., which is a key reference for representation learning.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We employ deep representation learning based on autoencoders owing to their architectural simplicity and expressivity, and established applications in healthcare.

name.justification: The paper uses UK Biobank data for training and validating their model.
name.quote: We demonstrate the use of the framework on large-scale multimodal data from UK Biobank to derive diverse representations of the population, quantify model performance, and institute responsive remediation.

referenced_paper_title.value: UK biobank: an open access resource for identifying the causes of a wide range of complex diseases of middle and old age
referenced_paper_title.justification: The UK Biobank is a widely recognized dataset and is explicitly cited in the related paper by Sudlow et al.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The dataset for this study was drawn from the UK Biobank. The UK Biobank was established as a major prospective study with significant involvement from the UK Medical Research Council and the Wellcome Trust.

name.justification: The paper mentions using the Pytorch library for neural network modeling.

referenced_paper_title.value: Pytorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library
referenced_paper_title.justification: Pytorch is a known library for deep learning and is used in the implementation of the neural network model in this paper.
